intro: Galium leptogonium, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, prostrate stems that often root at the nodes, forming dense mats. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its delicate appearance. Galium leptogonium is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
